intro: Urostachys apolinari-mariae, commonly known as the Mariae's strobilus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to the high-altitude regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and flowering structures. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and unique inflorescence that resembles a cone, composed of tightly packed bracts. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
